name: Vada Pav
description: Vada pav is a popular and delicious Maharashtrian street food of fried batter coated potato dumplings sandwiched in a pav (soft dinner rolls), together with sweet tamarind chutney, green chutney and dry garlic chutney.
recipeIngredient: 350 grams potatoes (or 2 medium to large sized potatoes)
1 to 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves ((cilantro leaves))
½ cup water (or add as required)
1 to 2  garlic cloves (- small to medium-sized, chopped)
½ cup seedless tamarind (- tightly packed)
7 to 8 tablespoons jaggery powder (or grated jaggery - add as required adjusting to your taste)
salt (or black salt, add as required)
3 to 4  fried green chillies (mixed with some salt, optional)

itemListElement.text: Grind all the green chutney ingredients with little water till smooth. Avoid making a watery chutney.
itemListElement.name: Grind all the green chutney ingredients with little water till smooth. Avoid making a watery chutney.

itemListElement.text: Soak tamarind in hot water for 30 to 40 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Soak tamarind in hot water for 30 to 40 minutes.

itemListElement.text: With your hands, squeeze the pulp from the tamarind in the same bowl or pan. strain the pulp and keep aside.
itemListElement.name: With your hands, squeeze the pulp from the tamarind in the same bowl or pan. strain the pulp and keep aside.

itemListElement.text: Heat oil in a small pan. lower the flame & add cumin seeds and let them crackle.
itemListElement.name: Heat oil in a small pan. lower the flame & add cumin seeds and let them crackle.

itemListElement.text: Add ginger powder, red chili powder, asafoetida. Stir and add the strained tamarind pulp. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Add ginger powder, red chili powder, asafoetida. Stir and add the strained tamarind pulp. Cook for 2-3 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Add the jaggery and salt and cook for 4-5 mins more. The mixture would thicken. Let the saunth chutney mixture cool.
itemListElement.name: Add the jaggery and salt and cook for 4-5 mins more. The mixture would thicken. Let the saunth chutney mixture cool.

itemListElement.text: When cooled, store the saunth chutney in an air-tight dry jar or container. Refrigerate and serve the saunth chutney whenever required with chaat or snacks.
itemListElement.name: When cooled, store the saunth chutney in an air-tight dry jar or container. Refrigerate and serve the saunth chutney whenever required with chaat or snacks.

itemListElement.text: Boil or steam potatoes in an Instant pot, pressure cooker or pan until they are completely cooked. Peel and then mash them with a fork in a bowl.
itemListElement.name: Boil or steam potatoes in an Instant pot, pressure cooker or pan until they are completely cooked. Peel and then mash them with a fork in a bowl.

itemListElement.text: Crush garlic and green chillies to a semi-fine paste in a mortar-pestle.
itemListElement.name: Crush garlic and green chillies to a semi-fine paste in a mortar-pestle.

itemListElement.text: Heat oil in a small pan. Add mustard seeds and crackle them. Then add curry leaves and asafoetida. Stir and fry for about 5 seconds.
itemListElement.name: Heat oil in a small pan. Add mustard seeds and crackle them. Then add curry leaves and asafoetida. Stir and fry for about 5 seconds.

itemListElement.text: Then add crushed garlic and green chilies paste, which have been crushed in a mortar-pestle. Add turmeric powder. Stir for some seconds until the raw aroma of garlic goes away. Do not brown garlic.
itemListElement.name: Then add crushed garlic and green chilies paste, which have been crushed in a mortar-pestle. Add turmeric powder. Stir for some seconds until the raw aroma of garlic goes away. Do not brown garlic.

itemListElement.text: Pour this tempering in the mashed potatoes.
itemListElement.name: Pour this tempering in the mashed potatoes.

itemListElement.text: Add chopped coriander leaves and salt.
itemListElement.name: Add chopped coriander leaves and salt.

itemListElement.text: Mix everything well and then make small to medium balls from the mashed potato mixture. Flatten these balls a bit. Cover and set aside.
itemListElement.name: Mix everything well and then make small to medium balls from the mashed potato mixture. Flatten these balls a bit. Cover and set aside.

itemListElement.text: In another bowl, make a smooth and thick yet flowing batter from the besan, turmeric powder, asafoetida, a pinch of baking soda (optional), salt and water.
itemListElement.name: In another bowl, make a smooth and thick yet flowing batter from the besan, turmeric powder, asafoetida, a pinch of baking soda (optional), salt and water.

itemListElement.text: The batter should not be very thick or thin. If the batter becomes thin, add 1 or 2 tablespoons of gram flour. If the batter becomes thin, then add 1 or 2 tablespoons water. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: The batter should not be very thick or thin. If the batter becomes thin, add 1 or 2 tablespoons of gram flour. If the batter becomes thin, then add 1 or 2 tablespoons water. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: In a kadai or pan, heat oil for deep frying.
itemListElement.name: In a kadai or pan, heat oil for deep frying.

itemListElement.text: When the oil becomes medium hot, then dip the slightly flattened potato balls in the batter and coat it evenly with the batter.
itemListElement.name: When the oil becomes medium hot, then dip the slightly flattened potato balls in the batter and coat it evenly with the batter.

itemListElement.text: Gently and carefully add these batter coated potato balls in medium hot oil.
itemListElement.name: Gently and carefully add these batter coated potato balls in medium hot oil.

itemListElement.text: Depending on the size of the kadai or pan, you can add more or less of the vadas while frying. Don't overcrowd the pan while frying.
itemListElement.name: Depending on the size of the kadai or pan, you can add more or less of the vadas while frying. Don't overcrowd the pan while frying.

itemListElement.text: When one side becomes crisp, lightly golden and firms up then gently turn it over with a slotted spoon and fry the second side. Turn over when the second side is fried.
itemListElement.name: When one side becomes crisp, lightly golden and firms up then gently turn it over with a slotted spoon and fry the second side. Turn over when the second side is fried.

itemListElement.text: This way turning a couple of times fry the batata vada till they are evenly golden on all sides.
itemListElement.name: This way turning a couple of times fry the batata vada till they are evenly golden on all sides.

itemListElement.text: Drain them on kitchen paper towels. Make all batata vadas this way and keep aside.
itemListElement.name: Drain them on kitchen paper towels. Make all batata vadas this way and keep aside.

itemListElement.text: When they are still hot or warm, you need to serve them. Take all the chutneys and pav on your work surface.
itemListElement.name: When they are still hot or warm, you need to serve them. Take all the chutneys and pav on your work surface.

itemListElement.text: Slice the pav without breaking it into two parts and keep aside. If you don't have sweet chutney, then just make the vada pav with green chutney.
itemListElement.name: Slice the pav without breaking it into two parts and keep aside. If you don't have sweet chutney, then just make the vada pav with green chutney.

itemListElement.text: Spread both the green chutney and sweet chutney on the sliced pav. You can also spread green chutney on one side and sweet chutney on the other side.
itemListElement.name: Spread both the green chutney and sweet chutney on the sliced pav. You can also spread green chutney on one side and sweet chutney on the other side.

itemListElement.text: Sprinkle the dry garlic chutney. This is optional and if you don't have you can skip it.
itemListElement.name: Sprinkle the dry garlic chutney. This is optional and if you don't have you can skip it.

itemListElement.text: Place the hot batata vada sandwiched in the bread slices.
itemListElement.name: Place the hot batata vada sandwiched in the bread slices.

itemListElement.text: Serve vada pav immediately or else the pav becomes soggy. You can also serve some fried salted green chillies and both the chutney along with it.
itemListElement.name: Serve vada pav immediately or else the pav becomes soggy. You can also serve some fried salted green chillies and both the chutney along with it.

itemListElement.text: You can also serve them as an evening snack with a side of ginger chai or coffee.
itemListElement.name: You can also serve them as an evening snack with a side of ginger chai or coffee.
